title.0: If a bilateral ceasefire or peace agreement in the Russo-Ukraine conflict goes into effect in 2025, how long will it last?

question_description.0:
*This question was created in collaboration with the RAND Forecasting Initiative,* [*<u>Glimt</u>*](https://glimt.nu/glimt/en/welcome.html)*, and Metaculus, and has been posted simultaneously on all three platforms for comparative purposes.*

***

The Russo-Ukrainian conflict has seen numerous attempts at peace negotiations since its escalation in February 2022. Early talks were held in Belarus and Turkey in February 2022, but these negotiations stalled due to disagreements over key issues like territorial control and NATO membership ([<u>New York Times</u>](https://www.nytimes.com/2022/02/28/world/europe/ukraine-russia-talks-belarus.html), [<u>Al Jazeera</u>](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/3/10/top-russia-ukraine-diplomats-arrive-in-turkey-for-talks)). Recently, U.S. President Donald Trump has been involved in efforts to restart negotiations, following a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin ([<u>The Guardian</u>](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/feb/12/trump-putin-ukraine-ceasefire)). In February 2025, negotiations between the U.S. and Ukraine over access to Ukraine’s critical minerals in exchange for security guarantees fell through after the two countries’ presidents clashed in the Oval Office ([<u>NBC News</u>](https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/zelenskyy-trump-white-house-russia-peace-talks-rare-earth-minerals-rcna194118)). The two countries met again in Saudi Arabia on 11 March 2025, and Ukraine agreed to support the U.S.’s proposal for a 30-day ceasefire with Russia ([<u>Reuters</u>](https://www.reuters.com/world/us-ukraine-meet-saudi-arabia-after-disastrous-white-house-talks-2025-03-11/)). In response, Russian President Vladimir Putin has said he supports the idea of the ceasefire proposal, but that there are still outstanding questions to address ([<u>BBC</u>](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cp8l00l4rejo)). Russia's agreement is still required for the ceasefire to take effect.
question_description.1:
The [Tour de France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_Tour_de_France) is an annual men's multiple stage bicycle race held primarily in France. It is the most prestigious bicycle race in the world. Its [112th edition](https://www.letour.fr/en/overall-route) will start in Lille, France, on July 5, 2025. The race will end on the Champs-Élysées in Paris on July 27, 2025.

Tadej Pogačar, [possibly the most gifted cyclist of all time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tadej_Poga%C4%8Dar#Comparisons_with_Eddy_Merckx), is favored to win this year's Tour. He has previously won the race in 2020, 2021, and 2024. However, his main rival, Jonas Vingegaard, is [exceptionally strong](https://www.welovecycling.com/wide/2023/07/26/opinion-pogacar-vs-vingegaard-is-already-the-tours-greatest-ever-rivalry/), and the Tour is [notoriously dangerous](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_racing_cyclists_and_pacemakers_with_a_cycling-related_death); upsets and disaster are frequent.
question_description.2:
On [22 April 2025, near Pahalgam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_Pahalgam_attack), in Indian administered Kashmir, militants killed 26 individuals in an attack. Following the attack, India, and Pakistan engaged in [hostile diplomatic measures](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_India%E2%80%93Pakistan_standoff) aimed at each other. Starting on the night of 24-25 April 2025, [skirmishes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_India%E2%80%93Pakistan_border_skirmishes), and exchanges of gunfire reportedly started along the Line of Control.

The event is a part of the broader [Kashmir conflict](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kashmir_conflict), which started after the partition of India in 1947. Both of the countries claim sovereignty over each other's de facto territory in the area. Tensions restarted after India [revoked the autonomy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Revocation_of_the_special_status_of_Jammu_and_Kashmir) of Jammu and Kashmir in 2019.
question_description.3:
"Grand Theft Auto VI" is one of the most anticipated video games of recent years, with widespread interest and <u>speculation regarding its release date</u> (https://www.pushsquare.com/news/2025/02/the-gta-6-2025-release-window-may-have-just-gotten-smaller). Rockstar Games has historically achieved global releases for the GTA series, though release dates and regional availability are subject to change. Europe represents a significant market for the video game.

 As of February 2025, Rockstar Games has officially announced that "Grand Theft Auto VI" is scheduled for release in the third or fourth quarter of 2025, [ <u>specifically in the fall season</u> ](https://www.pushsquare.com/news/2025/02/the-gta-6-2025-release-window-may-have-just-gotten-smaller). The game will be available on the PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S platforms. While the announcement confirms a 2025 release, it does not specify regional availability. Additionally, delays are a possibility.
question_description.4:
The federal budget process in the United States begins with the passage of a [budget resolution](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation#how-does-congress-start-the-cbpp-anchor) — a concurrent resolution passed by both the House and Senate that sets broad fiscal targets for spending, revenue, the deficit, and debt levels. While it provides a framework for the upcoming fiscal year, it does not become law and does not require the president’s signature. Importantly, the budget resolution may include reconciliation instructions, which direct specific congressional committees to draft legislation that meets the resolution’s fiscal goals. These instructions are optional but allow for the creation of a [reconciliation bill](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation), which allows the Senate to pass certain budget-related laws with a simple majority vote and limited debate, bypassing the [filibuster](https://www.senate.gov/about/powers-procedures/filibusters-cloture.htm).

If reconciliation instructions are included, the resulting reconciliation bill must be passed by both chambers and signed by the president to become law. It can include changes to spending, revenue, or the debt limit, but is restricted by rules such as the [Byrd Rule](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation#what-is-the-byrd-rule-cbpp-anchor), which prohibits provisions unrelated to budget changes. If the budget resolution does not include reconciliation instructions, Congress must enact any fiscal changes through the regular legislative process. In this case, changes to [discretionary spending](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/federal-spending/#the-difference-between-mandatory-discretionary-and-supplemental-spending) are made through the annual appropriations bills, which fund specific government departments and require presidential approval. Changes to mandatory spending programs (like Medicare, [Medicaid](https://usafacts.org/articles/how-much-of-the-federal-budget-is-mandatory-spending/), or Social Security), however, require standalone legislation that amends the law governing those programs. These also must pass both chambers and be signed by the president, and they generally face a higher procedural hurdle in the Senate due to the possibility of a filibuster.

House and Senate Republicans have passed separate budget resolutions in March and April 2025, with the Senate version calling for approximately \$4 billion in spending cuts, and the House version aiming for \$1.5 trillion in cuts. The total impact on the deficit over 10 years is reported by the Bipartisan Policy Center as follows for the [Senate version](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/explainer/whats-in-the-fy2025-senate-budget-resolution/):

> While the reconciliation bill’s ultimate deficit impact is yet to be determined, the topline instructions in the Senate allow for an up to \$2 trillion deficit increase over 10 years. Due to overlapping instructions between committees and the use of a [“current policy” baseline](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/explainer/the-2025-tax-debate-all-about-that-baseline/), the actual topline is an up to <u>\$5.7 trillion deficit increase</u>.

And for the [House version](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/explainer/whats-in-the-fy2025-house-budget-resolution/):

> Republicans hope to leverage the reconciliation process this year to extend and expand on [expiring tax cuts](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/tax/). While the reconciliation bill’s ultimate deficit impact is yet to be determined, the topline instructions allow for an up to \$3.3 trillion deficit increase over 10 years.

President Trump has so far [backed the Senate version](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-johnson-urge-gop-to-back-budget-resolution/), though there is some opposition to this version among House Republicans.

The [Congressional Budget Office](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congressional_Budget_Office) (CBO) is required to produce [cost estimates](https://www.cbo.gov/cost-estimates) for many bills passed by Congress, and [uses a current-law baseline](https://www.pgpf.org/article/why-do-budget-baselines-matter/), as opposed to a current-policy baseline. For example, for the 2022 [Inflation Reduction Act](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inflation_Reduction_Act), the most recently enacted reconciliation bill as of April 2025, CBO [estimated](https://www.cbo.gov/publication/58455) a net decrease in the deficit from changes to direct spending and revenue of approximately \$58 billion over 10 years, as well as a nonscorable increase in revenue from IRS enforcement of \$180 billion, a total estimated decrease of \$238 billion decrease in the deficit over 10 years.
question_description.5:
The Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 (IRA) (H.R. 5376) is a United States federal law that was signed into law by then President Joe Biden on August 16, 2022. Boasting a \$437 billion package, the aims of the law are to reduce the deficit, lower the price of prescription drugs and spur investment into clean energy.

Despite its namesake and sweeping economic policies, the law was widely referred to as "Biden's Climate Bill" and was considered to be the largest and most significant US climate legislations ever with an aim to tackle climate change by cutting some four billion tonnes greenhouse gas emissions. Policies to achieve this aim includes:

* Tax rebates for qualifying electric vehicles.
* Consumer tax breaks for renewable energy investments in wind and solar.
* Business tax credits for clean energy manufacturing and production of wind, solar and nuclear power technologies as well as carbon capture technology.
* Imposition of fees for excessive methane flaring and venting from oil and gas drilling.

Trump - a climate change skeptic - has been scathing of the IRA and has taken executive action to scale back the law (see Colombia Law School's [Climate Backtracker](https://climate.law.columbia.edu/content/climate-backtracker)).

***

According to the [US Department of Energy](https://www.energy.gov/articles/clean-hydrogen-production-tax-credit-45v-resources):

> The Clean Hydrogen Production Tax Credit creates a new 10-year incentive for clean hydrogen of up to \$3.00/kilogram. For qualifying clean hydrogen, the credit provides a varying, four-tier incentive depending on the carbon intensity of the hydrogen production process.

Hydrogen is seen by many as an option to be a mainstream alternative, low carbon fuel. Clean (or green) hydrogen (i.e., produced with a low carbon intensity) is a key criterion for the tax credit. Production of green hydrogen is cost-intensive process thus scrapping of the tax credit system is likely to spell disaster for the few green hydrogen projects still considering final investment.

In the latter stages of his Presidency, [Biden loosened the 45V qualifying rules](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-01-03/biden-loosens-strict-rules-for-hydrogen-subsidies-worth-billions), allowing more carbon intensive hydrogen production methods to qualify for the tax credits (one example being being natural gas with carbon capture - commonly referred to as blue hydrogen).

Marty Durbin, president of the U.S. Chamber’s Global Energy Institute, [commented](https://www.uschamber.com/energy/u-s-chamber-statement-on-45v-tax-credit) on the modification of the rule, stating:

> “The incoming Administration will have an opportunity to improve the 45V rules to ensure the industry will attract the investments necessary to scale the hydrogen economy and help the U.S. lead the world in clean manufacturing.”
question_description.7:
The federal budget process in the United States begins with the passage of a [budget resolution](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation#how-does-congress-start-the-cbpp-anchor) — a concurrent resolution passed by both the House and Senate that sets broad fiscal targets for spending, revenue, the deficit, and debt levels. While it provides a framework for the upcoming fiscal year, it does not become law and does not require the president’s signature. Importantly, the budget resolution may include reconciliation instructions, which direct specific congressional committees to draft legislation that meets the resolution’s fiscal goals. These instructions are optional but allow for the creation of a [reconciliation bill](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation), which allows the Senate to pass certain budget-related laws with a simple majority vote and limited debate, bypassing the [filibuster](https://www.senate.gov/about/powers-procedures/filibusters-cloture.htm).

If reconciliation instructions are included, the resulting reconciliation bill must be passed by both chambers and signed by the president to become law. It can include changes to spending, revenue, or the debt limit, but is restricted by rules such as the [Byrd Rule](https://www.cbpp.org/research/introduction-to-budget-reconciliation#what-is-the-byrd-rule-cbpp-anchor), which prohibits provisions unrelated to budget changes. If the budget resolution does not include reconciliation instructions, Congress must enact any fiscal changes through the regular legislative process. In this case, changes to [discretionary spending](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/federal-spending/#the-difference-between-mandatory-discretionary-and-supplemental-spending) are made through the annual appropriations bills, which fund specific government departments and require presidential approval. Changes to mandatory spending programs (like Medicare, [Medicaid](https://usafacts.org/articles/how-much-of-the-federal-budget-is-mandatory-spending/), or Social Security), however, require standalone legislation that amends the law governing those programs. These also must pass both chambers and be signed by the president, and they generally face a higher procedural hurdle in the Senate due to the possibility of a filibuster.

House and Senate Republicans have passed separate budget resolutions in March and April 2025, with the Senate version calling for approximately \$4 billion in spending cuts, and the House version aiming for \$1.5 trillion in cuts. President Trump has so far [backed the Senate version](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-johnson-urge-gop-to-back-budget-resolution/), though there is some opposition to this version among House Republicans.

One similarity between House and Senate plans is that both would [require the Energy and Commerce Committee to find \$880 billion in cuts](https://www.healthcaredive.com/news/senate-advances-budget-resolution-medicaid/744385/) over 10 years. Reporting [suggests](https://www.healthcaredive.com/news/medicaid-cuts-necessary-meet-republican-budget-target-cbo/741937/) that this would likely require significant cuts to Medicaid, as spending under the purview of the Energy and Commerce Committee not part of Medicaid, Medicare, or the Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP) is much smaller than the \$880 billion in cuts required.

The [Congressional Budget Office](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Congressional_Budget_Office) (CBO) is required to produce [cost estimates](https://www.cbo.gov/cost-estimates) for many bills passed by Congress. Some examples of prior bills that cut Medicaid and their associated Medicaid spending impacts estimated by CBO are available [here](https://unidosus.org/blog/2025/02/21/house-budget-resolutions-largest-medicaid-cuts-in-us-history/).
question_description.8: In 2024, house prices in the city of Madrid rose by 20%, and the Madrid real estate market is expected to continue its upward trajectory in 2025. According to [ <u>Caixabank Research</u> ](https://www.caixabankresearch.com/en/sectoral-analysis/real-estate/spanish-real-estate-market-2024-2025-expansive-mode), the current state of the Spanish real estate market is generally characterized by strong demand and tight supply. [ <u>They forecast</u> ](https://www.caixabankresearch.com/en/sectoral-analysis/real-estate/new-forecasts-spanish-real-estate-sector-expansionary-cycle-takes) a 6%-7% increase for house prices in Spain.
question_description.9: India and Japan are among the largest economies in the world. India has experienced rapid economic growth in recent decades, potentially positioning itself to overtake Japan in terms of nominal GDP. By 2024, Japan was the 4th largest economy, with a GDP of $4.07 trillion, while India was the 5th, with $3.89 trillion (IMF). This economic trajectory underscores the dynamic shifts in global economic power.
question_description.10:
The 45X Advanced Manufacturing Production Credit is a tax credit ([IRS](https://www.irs.gov/credits-deductions/advanced-manufacturing-production-credit)) for domestic production in the United States of [components](https://www.plantemoran.com/explore-our-thinking/insight/2023/09/understanding-the-section-45x-tax-credit-for-manufacturers) of clean energy, such as inverters for solar panels, blades of wind turbines, and electrode materials for batteries. 45X was established by the 2022 Inflation Reduction Act (IRA), which had a goal of creating a thriving, rapidly-growing clean energy sector. The role of 45X is to help the upstream manufacturers, to help ensure that a rapidly-growing sectors such as solar would have the equipment it needed to meet demand, since tax credits boost after-tax profits and thus reduce the cost of capital. 

With solar manufacturing for example, a factory making a 2 gigawatts per year, considered a modest-sized plant, could generate an annual tax credit of \$140 million, [according to Utility Dive](https://www.utilitydive.com/news/us-treasury-irs-releases-detailed-guidance-on-45X-clean-energy-tax-credits/702691/). This spurred a surge in investments in clean energy component manufacturing; in the year following the IRA being enacted, the clean energy manufacturing sector announced over \$140 billion in new investments, which was double the amount in the two years before the IRA's enactment.

In November 2024, Donald Trump was elected president, along with Republican majorities in the House and Senate, with the [aim](https://www.msnbc.com/opinion/msnbc-opinion/trump-second-term-biden-climate-change-rcna126810) to "maximize fossil fuel production" according to a Trump campaign official, who added, "Some of the price tags involved with some of these credits seem to be wildly understated... We’d be looking to cut a lot of that spending." 

At the time of this question, Republicans in the House and Senate are working on budget reconciliation, a parliamentary procedure in the US that allows tax and spending bills to be passed with a simple majority. In the House Republicans have a slim 7-seat majority, and recently 21 Republican representatives [wrote a letter ](https://www.politico.com/news/2025/03/10/house-republican-clean-energy-tax-breaks-00218126)to the Chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee warning that they would oppose eliminating the clean energy incentives. According to Politico:

> The growing pushback against eliminating the IRA’s hundreds of billions of dollars in tax credits and other incentives — which have largely [benefited GOP-controlled districts](https://www.politico.com/news/2023/08/13/biden-inflation-reduction-act-climate-states-00110940) — will complicate efforts by House Republicans to slash federal outlays without shrinking Medicaid spending as they seek to offset the tax cuts in their budget bill.

> “We need the projects that are currently under development to be brought online so we can continue the President’s ‘America First’ agenda,” added Garbarino, who previously led a letter last fall with 17 other Republicans urging leadership not to gut the credits. “These \[credits] are helping the president accomplish what he said he wanted to do in his campaign, and that was to make America an energy dominant country.”

> Up until now, Republicans haven’t detailed how far they are willing to go to protect these credits as Trump seeks to dismantle former President Joe Biden’s climate agenda, even as other members have loudly [balked about cuts to Medicaid](https://www.politico.com/news/2025/02/24/medicaid-gop-cuts-republicans-congress-00205542).

GOP lawmakers have expressed concerns that companies have already made investments for various projects, and that therefore their preference would be to phase out credits such as 45X earlier rather than do a full and immediate repeal. 45X has in particular received strong GOP support, with Republican Congressman Bob Latta of Ohio [saying](https://www.eenews.net/articles/can-the-ira-manufacturing-tax-credit-be-saved/), "Domestic manufacturing is a big priority for us, and it seems that particular credit is helping with that. We have to figure out some of the things that are working in the IRA."
question_description.11:
The 2022 [Inflation Reduction Act](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inflation_Reduction_Act) included provisions incentivising clean energy projects to meet policy goals by increasing the size of the pre-existing **ITC (Investment Tax Credit)** and **PTC (Production Tax Credit)** when certain conditions are met. These credit bumps are termed "adders".

The ITC starts at 6% of base project cost and PTC starts at 0.5 cents/kWh generated.

[Adders from the Inflation Reduction Act include](https://www.epa.gov/green-power-markets/summary-inflation-reduction-act-provisions-related-renewable-energy), for example:

* Increasing the ITC from 6% to 30% when workers are paid at least the prevailing wage and certain apprenticeship requirements are met;
* Adding 10% to the Investment Tax Credit when materials are sourced sufficiently domestically;
* A 0.3¢/kWh increase to PTC for being sited in a brownfield location or an area related to mining operations

![Bar charts showing Investment Tax Credit (ITC) potential and Production Tax Credit (PTC) potential](https://www.enelnorthamerica.com/content/dam/enel-na/ira-2022/inflation-reduction-act-bonus-tax-credit-blog-figure-1.png)

(image [source](https://www.enelnorthamerica.com/insights/blogs/maximizing-inflation-reduction-act-of-2022-bonus-tax-credits); note that values vary based on project size and other factors)

The IRA is speculated to be [at risk under Trump](https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en-us/posts/corporates/ira-uncertain-future/); one of Trump's day-one executive orders included the following language:

> [Sec. 7.  Terminating the Green New Deal.\*\*  (a)  All agencies shall immediately pause the disbursement of funds appropriated through the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022](https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/2025/01/unleashing-american-energy/#:~:text=Sec.%207.%20%C2%A0Terminating%20the%20Green%20New%20Deal.%C2%A0%20\(a\)%20%C2%A0All%20agencies%20shall%20immediately%20pause%20the%20disbursement%20of%20funds%20appropriated%20through%20the%20Inflation%20Reduction%20Act%20of%202022)
question_description.12: Inditex, the Spanish multinational known for owning brands such as Zara, is the [ <u>largest company in Spain by market capitalization</u> ](https://companiesmarketcap.com/spain/largest-companies-in-spain-by-market-cap/) and a major player in international markets. As of February 2025, Inditex ranks 11th among Europe's largest companies by market capitalization, closely following Deutsche Telekom and Siemens. With a market capitalization of approximately $175 billion, Inditex would need to overtake Deutsche Telekom, currently valued at around $179.68 billion, to break into the top 10.
question_description.13:
Technology has transformed many areas of the financial industry: [high frequency trading firms](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High-frequency_trading) have transformed the ways stocks and other securities are traded, neobrokers like [Robinhood](https://robinhood.com/gb/en/) or [Freetrade](https://freetrade.io/) have changed the way retail investors participate in the stock market and neobanks like [Nubank](https://international.nubank.com.br/about/), which is valued at over \$100 billion, has grown into one of the most popular financial brands in LatAm. Revolut, originating in the UK, has the ambition of building a global super app, with a core focus on financial services.

[Revolut](https://revolut.com/) has grown incredibly since its founding in 2015 and now some report over 6M users in the UK (and over 30M globally). Revolut first obtained [a banking licence for the EEA (European Economic Area), that was granted by the Bank of Lithuania](https://help.revolut.com/help/more/legal-topics/is-revolut-a-bank/). On July 25, 2024, Revolut was [awarded](https://www.revolut.com/news/revolut_receives_uk_banking_licence/) a UK banking license which was a significant milestone for the company, ending a three-year wait.

The license awarded by the Prudential Regulation Authority with restrictions (commonly referred to as a provisional license) whilst the bank goes through a so-called "mobilisation phase" which a Bloomberg [article](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-03-13/revolut-hiring-hundreds-to-become-a-fully-fledged-uk-bank) summarises:

> The “mobilization phase” is a common step for many new entrants in the UK, with rivals including Monzo Bank Ltd., Starling Bank Ltd. and Atom Bank Plc going through the process previously. Revolut has been able to trial and run critical banking systems with around 30 customers that have combined deposits of £50,000, Carlesi said.

The same article suggests that the mobilisation stage is likely to conclude by July:

> The regulator normally expects this stage to conclude within 12 months, meaning Revolut would become a fully fledged bank by July. Once the regulator gives the green light, Revolut will be able to migrate its millions of UK customers from its electronic money institution to its UK bank entity — Revolut NewCo UK Ltd.

***

*Background adapted from* [*Will Revolut obtain a UK banking license before the end of 2024?*](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21860/revolut-banking-licence/)
question_description.14: Bitcoin is the most well-known cryptocurrency with the largest market capitalization. Its price is highly volatile and can fluctuate rapidly due to regulatory, demand, and speculative factors. In 2024, bitcoin is up by approximately 125%. In 2025, President Donald Trump has taken <u>a [ pro-crypto stance</u> ](https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/trump-signs-order-create-cryptocurrency-working-group-2025-01-23/), issuing an executive order to promote digital assets and explore new regulations. The Trump administration aims to position the US as a leader in digital financial technology, which could boost cryptocurrencies.
question_description.16:
The Republicans achieved a "legislative trifecta" in the 2024 elections - control of the White House, Senate, and House of Representatives - although lacking the 60-vote Senate supermajority, having won 53 out of 100 seats.

In the immediate aftermath of the election, senior Republicans began [planning](https://www.politico.com/live-updates/2024/11/25/congress/gop-leaders-meet-to-talk-reconciliation-00191590) how to turn Donald Trump's extensive legislative agenda into reality. One option would include the use of budget [reconciliation](https://www.cbo.gov/topics/budget/reconciliation#:~:text=Budget%20reconciliation%20is%20an%20expedited,in%20a%20Congressional%20budget%20resolution.), a process that allows certain federal budget bills to pass in the Senate with only a simple majority, bypassing the 60-vote threshold typically required to overcome a [filibuster](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Filibuster_in_the_United_States_Senate). Reconciliation also limits debate time, preventing the use of the filibuster altogether.

A key priority expected to be included in a reconciliation bill is the renewal of [Trump’s 2017 tax cuts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tax_Cuts_and_Jobs_Act) - a central pillar of his campaign, with most of them set to expire at the end of 2025. This is controversial, as it could violate the [Byrd Rule](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reconciliation_\(United_States_Congress\)#Byrd_Rule) if it increases the federal deficit beyond the allowable budget window without offsetting revenue or spending adjustments. Additionally, Trump and the GOP have suggested using reconciliation to pass policies related to border security and energy permitting, though the impact of these measures on federal spending is less clear.

Some senior Republicans argue that border security constitutes a national emergency. In contrast to House Speaker Mike Johnson’s ["one, big beautiful bill"](https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/5067370-mike-johnson-donald-trump-house-gop-reconciliation/), they have proposed using a standalone reconciliation bill to address border security first, followed by a separate bill covering other priorities such as tax policy and the debt ceiling.
question_description.17: The [ <u>World Inequality Database</u> ](https://wid.world/) (WID) tracks inequality and wealth indicators globally. The "Average national wealth at market value per adult" measures average wealth per adult in terms of market value, providing insights into global economic changes and wealth distribution. This metric reflects changes in economic conditions, but also dynamics of capital redistribution/concentration.
question_description.18: The major tech companies, often referred to as FAANG (Facebook, Apple, Amazon, Netflix, and Google), have dominated global market capitalization in recent years. As of February 2025, Apple leads with a market cap of $3.657 trillion, followed by Nvidia ($3.435 trillion) and Microsoft ($3.039 trillion). Amazon and Alphabet round out the top five. Notably, Saudi Aramco, a non-tech company, is ranked sixth, while Meta Platforms is ranked seventh.
question_description.19: Spain and the Eurozone publish their GDP figures quarterly via <u>Eurostat</u> . The relative growth of the Spanish economy compared to the Eurozone average is an indicator of the competitiveness and resilience of both regions. Between 2023 and 2024 (Q3), Spain grew by 3.5% compared to 0.9% for the Eurozone ([ <u>Eurostat</u> ](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/products-euro-indicators/w/2-06122024-ap#fragment-15944082-grio-inline-nav-8)).
question_description.20:
On March 14, 2023, OpenAI announced its GPT-4 model. On May 13, 2024, OpenAI released GPT-4o, highlighting improvements to vision and reasoning capabilities. In February 2025, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman shared a roadmap that included details about the GPT-4.5 and GPT-5 models. OpenAI plans to integrate several technologies into GPT-5, promising a more unified and capable system. Although exact dates were not given, it was mentioned that the launch could occur in "[ <u>weeks/months</u> ](https://www.axios.com/2025/02/12/openai-chatgpt-roadmap-gpt5)".

 There has been speculation about possible advancements in GPT-5, including improved multimodal capabilities, increased processing efficiency, and better adaptability in real-world applications. OpenAI has also focused on refining AI alignment and safety measures, which may impact the timing of GPT-5’s release. But the competitive landscape for AI models continues to evolve rapidly, so new systems are expected to launch quickly.
question_description.21: The FrontierMath benchmark, detailed on <u>Epoch AI’s [ FrontierMath page</u> ](https://epoch.ai/frontiermath/the-benchmark), is designed to test cutting-edge mathematical reasoning in AI systems. It consists of challenging, non-trivial problems that require both symbolic and numerical reasoning, going far beyond the scope of standard mathematical benchmarks. As AI research is rapidly advancing—with progress on large language models (LLMs) and mathematical “reasoning” systems—achieving a score above 85% on FrontierMath would signal a significant advancement in the field.
question_description.22:
On January 20, 2025, President Donald Trump signed the executive order [Protecting the Meaning and Value of American Citizenship](https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/2025/01/protecting-the-meaning-and-value-of-american-citizenship/)*,* instructing agencies to [deny automatic citizenship](https://apnews.com/article/what-has-trump-done-trump-executive-orders-f061fbe7f08c08d81509a6af20ef8fc0) to children whose parents are neither US citizens nor lawful permanent residents. Immigrants-rights groups, citing the [Fourteenth Amendment](https://constitutioncenter.org/blog/revisiting-the-birthright-citizenship-question-and-the-constitution) and the Supreme Court’s 1898 landmark [*United States v. Wong Kim Ark*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_v._Wong_Kim_Ark), sued in several districts, and the order was [quickly blocked](https://apnews.com/article/birthright-citizenship-donald-trump-lawsuit-immigration-9ac27b234c854a68a9b9f8c0d6cd8a1c). After losing in two courts of appeals, the administration asked the Supreme Court for emergency relief, arguing that the phrase “subject to the jurisdiction thereof” permits limiting birthright citizenship.

On April 17, 2025, the [Court granted certiorari](https://www.scotusblog.com/2025/04/justices-will-hear-arguments-on-trumps-effort-to-end-birthright-citizenship/) and set oral argument for May 15, 2025. The Court's [order](https://www.supremecourt.gov/orders/courtorders/041725zr1_4gd5.pdf) also left in place stays by lower courts that halted enforcement of the executive order. A decision is [expected](https://www.scotusblog.com/2025/04/justices-will-hear-arguments-on-trumps-effort-to-end-birthright-citizenship/#:~:text=A%20decision%20in%20the%20case%20will%20likely%20follow%20by%20late%20June%20or%20early%20July.) in June or July, 2025.
question_description.23:
Bluesky is a decentralized social network, initially incubated by Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey. Its goal is to provide an open alternative to traditional social media platforms.

 Bluesky has surpassed 32 million users, according to [ <u>Jazco's Bluesky Stats</u> ](https://bsky.jazco.dev/stats), experiencing massive growth since its public launch in February 2024. This surge is partly attributed to users leaving X (Twitter) following changes implemented by Elon Musk; and also to Donald Trump's re-election in November 2024. Reaching 100 million users by the end of the year would represent a significant milestone.
question_description.24:
The 2025 presidential election, [<u>scheduled for May 18</u>](https://apnews.com/article/poland-president-election-duda-trzaskowski-f580dc709a38f927ed2291fb49cb1869)<u>,</u> comes at a crucial time for Poland. The nation is deeply polarized, with ongoing debates over rule of law issues and tensions between urban and rural populations. The outcome of next May’s vote could unblock Prime Minister Tusk’s reform agenda, which has been stymied by outgoing right-wing President Andrzej Duda since the nationalist Law and Justice (PiS) party was ousted from power last December.

Rafał Trzaskowski is the presidential candidate of the ruling Civic Coalition, led by Prime Minister Donald Tusk. Trzaskowski is [<u>known for his progressive stance</u>](https://www.ft.com/content/db73120d-1291-4252-9500-adf32e3b7f7a), emphasizing European integration, social policies and judicial independence. Trzaskowski's main opponent is Karol Nawrocki, a historian, who has been nominated by the PiS party. Nawrocki's platform aligns with the party's patriotic and pro-Christian values. The election is expected to be highly competitive.
question_description.27:
The Clean Electricity Production Tax Credit (PTC), also known as the 45Y credit referring to the section of the US Code from which it comes,  [is a tax incentive](https://www.irs.gov/credits-deductions/clean-electricity-production-credit) created by the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA), to incent companies to generate electricity with net zero greenhouse gas emissions. It is technology-neutral, meaning it offers the incentive to any form of electrical production that does not on net create carbon emissions, such as wind, solar, nuclear and geothermal. According to [Crux Climate](https://www.cruxclimate.com/insights/tech-neutral-tax-credits):

> The §45Y tax credit value is determined per unit of electricity production. The base value of the §45Y credit mirrors the legacy §45 PTC, at 0.3 cents per KWh (adjusted for inflation), increased to 1.5 cents per KWh for facilities that meet prevailing wage and apprenticeship (PWA) standards.

> Companies can increase the value of the §45Y tax credit by siting a project in a designated energy community, satisfying [domestic content adder](https://www.cruxclimate.com/insights/domestic-content-safe-harbor) requirements, and/or qualifying for a [low-income bonus](https://www.cruxclimate.com/insights/low-income-community-bonus-credit-begins-today) for projects smaller than 5MWac. The value of each bonus adder increases the base value (either 0.3 cents or 1.5 cents) by 10%, except for certain low-income bonuses, which increase the value by 20%.

An analysis by Rhodium Group [estimated](https://rhg.com/research/tech-neutral-tax-credits-electric-power/) that that clean energy tax credits including 45Y could drive 146 to 308 gigawatts (GW) of clean energy generation capacity in America's electrical grid by 2030 and 259-648 GWs by 2035. 

In the 2022 general election, Republicans took control of the House of Representatives. They made [several attempts](https://climatepower.us/research-polling/inflation-reduction-act-repeal-votes-tracker/) to repeal various parts of the IRA, including clean energy tax credits such as 45Y, although it is important to note that most were symbolic efforts since Democrats controlled the Senate and the White House. According to the [Brookings Institution](https://www.brookings.edu/articles/what-will-happen-to-the-inflation-reduction-act-under-a-republican-trifecta/):

> Republican lawmakers have cited the cost of the IRA as one of the reasons to roll it back—for example, the House Committee on Ways and Means has [highlighted](https://gop-waysandmeans.house.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/230421-Two-Pager-Green-Energy-Credits-FINAL.pdf) the “exploding” cost of “green corporate welfare” under the IRA. The [cost of IRA’s “green subsidies”](https://waysandmeans.house.gov/2023/04/26/house-republicans-pass-limit-save-grow-act-to-rein-in-wasteful-spending-and-grow-the-economy/) was a part of the justification for introducing the [Limit, Save, Grow Act of 2023](https://www.congress.gov/bill/118th-congress/house-bill/2811), that [sought](https://climatepower.us/research-polling/inflation-reduction-act-repeal-votes-tracker/) to cut billions in funding from climate, environmental justice, and clean energy tax incentives from the IRA.

In January 2025, the House of Representatives was sworn in with Republicans controlling the chamber 220-213 (with 2 vacancies) and with Republicans controlling the Senate 53-47. Donald Trump was sworn in for his second term. Brookings continues:

> While it is easier for the IRA to be repealed under a Republican trifecta, it may be difficult to build a sufficiently large coalition in Congress to repeal the full IRA, as Republican lawmakers may prefer to retain certain IRA incentives that benefit their constituents. In August 2024, 18 Republican House Representatives [signed](https://www.politico.com/news/2024/08/25/republican-fight-inflation-reduction-act-00176223) a letter to Speaker Mike Johnson (R-LA) that asked for the IRA’s energy tax credits to be “spared” from attempts to repeal the IRA. A Senior Tax Policy Advisor on the Senate Finance Committee also [noted](https://tax.thomsonreuters.com/news/senate-tax-advisor-new-energy-credits-likely-safe-from-full-repeal-in-2025/) that a full repeal of clean energy tax incentives is unlikely regardless of the election results, as some parts of the IRA received bipartisan support before its enactment, which was expected to continue.

> Republican-held areas have benefitted from the IRA since its enactment, as [more than half](https://e2.org/reports/clean-economy-works-two-year-review-2024/) of announced clean energy and vehicle projects are located in Republican congressional districts. According to the Rhodium Group and MIT’s [Clean Investment Monitor](https://www.cleaninvestmentmonitor.org/database), Nevada and Wyoming had the highest level of actual clean investment as a percent of GDP between September 2023 and September 2024 – with 2.65% and 4.11% respectively. Nevada, Kentucky, and Georgia had the highest levels of actual clean manufacturing investment as a percent of GDP over the same period, with 1.1% for Georgia and Kentucky, and 1.2% for Nevada. In terms of federal investments, the most populous states, such as California and Texas, [received](https://www.cleaninvestmentmonitor.org/reports/tallying-the-two-year-impact-of-the-inflation-reduction-act) the most dollars. However, Nevada and Wyoming received the most federal investments per capita, as well as relative to the size of their GDP. This includes federal tax credits, grants, and fiscal cost of loans and loan guarantees.

> The Political Economy Research Institute (University of Massachusetts Amherst) [projected](https://peri.umass.edu/images/publication/BIL_IRA_CHIPS_9-18-23-1.pdf) that the IRA could have an employment impact of creating 848,728 jobs annually, across industries. Clean Jobs America [estimated](https://cleanjobsamerica.e2.org/) that there has been an increase of 14% in clean energy workers since the enactment of the IRA in August 2022,[<sup>2</sup>]() with 3.5 million workers in clean energy. Many of these jobs are in California (544,604 jobs), Texas (268,035 jobs), and New York (173,731 jobs).

In addition to a repeal of 45Y, another possibility would be earlier sunsets of the tax credit, which currently benefits energy production facilities placed into service after 2024 and before 2032. For that reason, as a "[thoughtful](https://www.eenews.net/articles/republicans-mull-thoughtful-phaseout-of-green-credits/)" alternative the 2032 phase-out might be moved to an earlier year. Phase-out starts the latter of 2032 or when America's GHG emissions from electricity are ≤25% of 2022 emissions. Additionally, there is a [safe harbor](https://www.solarpowerworldonline.com/2025/01/what-does-safe-harboring-mean-for-the-solar-industry/) for clean energy projects, which grandfathers in projects that have begun before the phase-out date, as long as the project has met certain thresholds, and a repeal of 45Y or earlier sunset might be mitigated by including a safe harbor possibility to protect investments.
question_description.28: Nvidia is a leading technology company specializing in AI and graphics processors. The company's stock has shown strong growth in recent years, driven by the increasing demand for AI technologies and graphics processing units (GPUs). In 2024, Nvidia's share price will increase by approximately 170%, reflecting its strong performance.
question_description.29:
The [ <u>Eurovision Song Contest 2025</u> ](https://eurovision.tv/event/basel-2025) is scheduled to take place in Basel, Switzerland, with the Grand Final on 17 May 2025. Spain has been a regular entrant, although its results over the past decade have been modest, with its best performance being a 3rd place in 2022 and a second best of 17th place in 2023. For the 2025 contest, Spain will be represented by the song "Esa Diva", performed by Melody. For a preview of Spain's entry, [ <u>you can watch Melody's performance here</u> ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H46FB-rLh04).

 Eurovision is one of the most watched non-sporting events in Europe, judged on a combination of jury and public votes. The contest remains a significant cultural event, attracting viewers and participants from across the continent.
question_description.30: Microsoft is one of the largest technology companies in the world, known for its software products as well as its cloud platform. By 2024, Microsoft's share price is expected to rise by approximately 50%, driven by significant advances in artificial intelligence and cloud computing. The company has integrated AI into all of its services, improving productivity tools and cloud solutions, consolidating its position as a leader in the AI sector.
question_description.31:
The People's Republic of China (PRC) officially claims to be the sole legitimate government of the islands of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen, and Matsu, while the Republic of China (ROC) currently governs the islands. Tensions between the two sides have persisted since the Chinese Civil War. Although there has been no active conflict since 1979, no formal armistice or peace treaty has been signed.

 Recent years have seen increased military activity and diplomatic tensions, with China conducting military exercises near Taiwan and increasing pressure through economic and political means. The United States and allied nations have also expressed support for Taiwanese autonomy, further complicating the geopolitical situation. The possibility of conflict remains a significant global concern, with potential implications for regional stability, global supply chains, and international diplomatic relations.
question_description.32:
The [2025 NATO summit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_The_Hague_summit) is an upcoming meeting of the heads of state and heads of government of the thirty-two members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), their partner countries, and the European Union, which will be held in The Hague, Netherlands, between June 24-26, 2025.

Since 2006, NATO members have aimed to spend at least 2% of GDP on defence, a target reaffirmed after Russia’s 2014 annexation of Crimea. By 2024, 23 of 32 members met this benchmark, driven by the ongoing war in Ukraine. 

By 2025, NATO officials increasingly argued that the 2% target was outdated, with Secretary General Mark Rutte stating that ["If we stick to the 2%, we cannot defend ourselves in four or five years."](https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/02/12/nato-allies-need-to-spend-considerably-more-to-deter-a-russian-attack-in-coming-years-rutt) This shift gained urgency in early 2025 when US President Donald Trump demanded members raise spending to 5% of GDP.

Further reading:

[Rutte: NATO spending target will be ‘considerably more than 3 percent’](https://www.politico.eu/article/mark-rutte-nato-defense-spending-target-considerably-more-3-percent-munich-security-conference/ "Rutte: NATO spending target will be ‘considerably more than 3 percent’")

[Rubio: US is committed to NATO, but Europe must spend more on defence](https://www.reuters.com/world/us-has-no-plans-sudden-withdrawal-europe-natos-rutte-says-2025-04-03/ "Rubio: US is committed to NATO, but Europe must spend more on defence")

[Germany: Trump's 5% NATO demand too costly, Scholz says](https://www.dw.com/en/germany-trumps-5-nato-demand-too-costly-scholz-says/a-71289250 "Germany: Trump's 5% NATO demand too costly, Scholz says")
question_description.33: In November 2024, Călin Georgescu, an <u>ultranationalist candidate with pro-Russian sentiments</u> , won the first round of Romania's presidential election. However, the Constitutional Court annulled the results due to allegations of Russian interference, including cyberattacks and manipulation through platforms such as TikTok. This unprecedented move sparked political unrest and widespread protests, with thousands of people demonstrating in Bucharest to support Georgescu. New elections are scheduled for May 2025, and recent polls indicate that Georgescu remains a <u>leading candidate</u> . The situation continues to evolve, with concerns about Romania's democratic integrity, foreign influence, and political stability at the forefront. A crowded race is expected, with multiple contenders from established and new parties announcing their candidacy.
question_description.34:
On August 16, 2022, President Joe Biden signed into law the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA), which [expanded](https://www.epa.gov/green-power-markets/summary-inflation-reduction-act-provisions-related-renewable-energy) the investment tax credits (ITC) for solar-generated electricity to cover all renewable sources, restored its levels to 30% of the project costs, and extended them through 2032. The IRA also established a [domestic content bonus credit](https://www.akingump.com/en/insights/alerts/irs-updates-ptc-and-itc-domestic-content-bonus-guidance) of up to 10% for projects whose steel/iron and a specific percentage of their components were made in the US.

In the wake of the 2024 US elections, Republicans took control of both Houses of Congress and the White House, with President Donald Trump [having expressed interest](https://www.brookings.edu/articles/what-will-happen-to-the-inflation-reduction-act-under-a-republican-trifecta/#the-ira-under-the-incoming-republican-white-house-and-congress) in reducing IRA spending. At the time of this question, congressional Republicans were working on a budget reconciliation bill to possibly enact tax and spending changes to the federal budget (see the Tax Foundation's updated [Budget Reconciliation tracker](https://taxfoundation.org/research/all/federal/trump-tax-cuts-2025-budget-reconciliation/)).

It is important to note that in the House of Representatives, the Republicans hold a slim majority of 220 to 213. In March 2025, a group of 21 Republican representatives [sent a letter](https://www.eenews.net/articles/republicans-mull-thoughtful-phaseout-of-green-credits/) to House Ways and Means Chairman Jason Smith to urge him to phase out rather than eliminate the clean energy incentives of the IRA. House Speaker Mike Johnson [told reporters](https://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/5167829-johnson-inflation-reduction-act-ira-climate-tax-infrastructure/), in regard to repealing clean energy tax credits among other policies, "It’ll be somewhere between a scalpel and a sledgehammer." It's important to note, too, that reconciliation bills do not always succeed. In July 2017, for example, Senator John McCain famously [cast](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/27/us/politics/senate-health-care-vote.html) a decisive No vote to a reconciliation bill that would have repealed parts of the Affordable Care Act.
question_description.35: Anthropic is an [ <u>artificial intelligence company</u> ](https://www.anthropic.com/) known for its Claude series of models. Claude 3.7 is the most recent model. The company has shown a continued commitment to advancing its technologies, leading to expectations of a higher model being released in 2025. Speculation surrounding Claude 4 suggests possible improvements in reasoning capabilities, multimodal understanding, and efficiency in handling complex queries. Given the rapidly evolving AI landscape, Anthropic could accelerate development to remain competitive against OpenAI, Google DeepMind, and other emerging AI labs.
question_description.37:
On August 16, 2022, President Joe Biden signed into law the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA), which [expanded](https://www.epa.gov/green-power-markets/summary-inflation-reduction-act-provisions-related-renewable-energy) the production tax credits (PTC) for wind and geothermal-generated electricity to cover most renewable sources and extended them through 2032. The IRA also established a [domestic content bonus credit](https://www.akingump.com/en/insights/alerts/irs-updates-ptc-and-itc-domestic-content-bonus-guidance) of up to 10% for projects whose steel/iron and a specific percentage of their components were made in the US.

In the wake of the 2024 US elections, Republicans took control of both Houses of Congress and the White House, with President Donald Trump [having expressed interest](https://www.brookings.edu/articles/what-will-happen-to-the-inflation-reduction-act-under-a-republican-trifecta/#the-ira-under-the-incoming-republican-white-house-and-congress) in reducing IRA spending. At the time of this question, congressional Republicans were working on a budget reconciliation bill to possibly enact tax and spending changes to the federal budget (see the Tax Foundation's updated [Budget Reconciliation tracker](https://taxfoundation.org/research/all/federal/trump-tax-cuts-2025-budget-reconciliation/)).

It is important to note that in the House of Representatives, the Republicans hold a slim majority of 220 to 213. In March 2025, a group of 21 Republican representatives [sent a letter](https://www.eenews.net/articles/republicans-mull-thoughtful-phaseout-of-green-credits/) to House Ways and Means Chairman Jason Smith to urge him to phase out rather than eliminate the clean energy incentives of the IRA. House Speaker Mike Johnson [told reporters](https://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/5167829-johnson-inflation-reduction-act-ira-climate-tax-infrastructure/), in regard to repealing clean energy tax credits among other policies, "It’ll be somewhere between a scalpel and a sledgehammer." It's important to note, too, that reconciliation bills do not always succeed. In July 2017, for example, Senator John McCain famously [cast](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/27/us/politics/senate-health-care-vote.html) a decisive No vote to a reconciliation bill that would have repealed parts of the Affordable Care Act.
question_description.39:
Pierre Poilievre, leader of the Conservative Party, has gained significant momentum [ <u>by appealing to voters dissatisfied with the current administration</u> ](https://www.ft.com/content/27bd5554-c0f3-4c9f-9682-9c903f38a075) on issues such as housing affordability, inflation and economic recovery. His platform calls for lower taxes, reduced government spending and “putting Canada first.”

 In January 2025, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau [ <u>announced his resignation</u> ](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/justin-trudeau-announces-plan-step-down-2025-01-06) amid declining popularity and internal party challenges. This political shift has intensified the competitiveness of the upcoming election, with [ <u>recent polls indicating a narrowing gap</u> ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2025_Canadian_federal_election) between the Conservative and Liberal parties. The election, which must be held no later than October 20, 2025, is expected to focus primarily on economic issues, health care, and Canada’s response to international trade pressures, particularly in light of recent U.S. tariff threats.

 According to updated information, Canada's federal election is scheduled to take place no later than October 20, 2025, under the country's electoral law. [ <u>Source</u> ](https://www.npr.org/2025/01/09/nx-s1-5251302/whats-next-for-canada-5-questions-will-help-decide-the-future-after-trudeau) [ <u>Source</u> ](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/canadas-main-opposition-leader-poilievre-rides-wave-anti-trudeau-discontent-2025-01-08/)

 Current polls show Pierre Poilievre and the Conservative Party have a significant lead, capitalizing on discontent with the Trudeau government. Following Justin Trudeau's surprise resignation in January 2025, the Canadian political landscape has undergone a major shift that favors Poilievre as the potential next Prime Minister. [ <u>Source</u> ](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/czjdr98n1kxo)
question_description.40:
On August 16, 2022, President Joe Biden signed into law the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA), which established the Advanced Manufacturing Production Tax Credit (AMPTC) for the domestic production of specific clean energy components.

In the wake of the 2024 US elections, Republicans took control of both Houses of Congress and the White House, with President Donald Trump [having expressed interest](https://www.brookings.edu/articles/what-will-happen-to-the-inflation-reduction-act-under-a-republican-trifecta/#the-ira-under-the-incoming-republican-white-house-and-congress) in reducing IRA spending. At the time of this question, congressional Republicans were working on a budget reconciliation bill to possibly enact tax and spending changes to the federal budget (see the Tax Foundation's updated [Budget Reconciliation tracker](https://taxfoundation.org/research/all/federal/trump-tax-cuts-2025-budget-reconciliation/)).

It is important to note that in the House of Representatives, the Republicans hold a slim majority of 220 to 213. In March 2025, a group of 21 Republican representatives [sent a letter](https://www.eenews.net/articles/republicans-mull-thoughtful-phaseout-of-green-credits/) to House Ways and Means Chairman Jason Smith to urge him to phase out rather than eliminate the clean energy incentives of the IRA. House Speaker Mike Johnson [told reporters](https://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/5167829-johnson-inflation-reduction-act-ira-climate-tax-infrastructure/), in regard to repealing clean energy tax credits among other policies, "It’ll be somewhere between a scalpel and a sledgehammer." It's important to note, too, that reconciliation bills do not always succeed. In July 2017, for example, Senator John McCain famously [cast](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/07/27/us/politics/senate-health-care-vote.html) a decisive No vote to a reconciliation bill that would have repealed parts of the Affordable Care Act.
question_description.41:
The Ibex 35 is the main stock market index of the Madrid Stock Exchange. It serves as a key barometer of the Spanish economy, reflecting national and international economic conditions. The composition of the index can be explored in detail [ <u>on Wikipedia</u> ](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBEX_35) <u>.</u>
 After leading the growth of EU stock markets in 2023 with a 23% increase, the IBEX 35 has remained near the top of the table in 2024, rising by 14.78%. It was the [ <u>second best-performing stock market index among major European markets</u> ](https://www.bolsasymercados.es/docs/infmercado/2024/ing/Market-Report-BME-2024.pdf).

question_resolution_criteria.0:
This question is conditional and will only resolve if a comprehensive bilateral ceasefire or peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine takes effect before 00:00 January 1, 2026 Ukraine Time (UTC+2). If no such ceasefire occurs by that date, the question will be **annulled**.

The question will resolve based on the number of consecutive days the ceasefire remains in effect before being abandoned. The ceasefire will be considered to have ended when any of the following occur:

* Either government officially withdraws from the ceasefire or declares the ceasefire terminated
* Major military operations resume that are acknowledged by international observers to constitute a breakdown of the ceasefire (see Notes/Fine Print).
* The ceasefire reaches its predetermined end date without being extended or renewed.
question_resolution_criteria.1: This question will resolve as the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the classement général, or overall winner, in the Tour de France 2025, based on results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).
question_resolution_criteria.2: This question will resolve as **Yes** if military conflict between India and Pakistan results in at least 100 deaths after May 1 and before July 1, 2025, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
question_resolution_criteria.3: This question will be resolved to **Yes** if, within 2025, "Grand Theft Auto VI" is available for sale in Europe through standard, authorized distribution channels. If the game is not released in Europe in 2025, the question will be resolved to **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.4:
This question will resolve as the total increase in the deficit over the period from fiscal year 2025 to 2034, inclusive, enacted as part of spending and revenue reconciliation bill(s) passed during fiscal year 2025. **This includes both direct and nonscorable effects.** If no such reconciliation bill(s) are enacted before the end of fiscal year 2025 (before October 1, 2025), this question will be **annulled**.

The question will resolve according to the cost estimate produced by the [Congressional Budget Office](https://www.cbo.gov/cost-estimates) (CBO) for the enacted reconciliation bill.
question_resolution_criteria.5:
This question will resolve as the outcome that is enacted next, before January 1, 2026, with respect to the planned start of the phase-out of the Clean Hydrogen Production Tax Credit (45V) ([26 U.S. Code § 45V](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/credit-for-production-of-clean-hydrogen-26-u-s-code-%c2%a7-45v/)).

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**2025-2026 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45V is fully repealed, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2025-2026 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45V is fully repealed, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2027 or 2028, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2027 or 2028, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45V is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

If no legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that reduces the planned phase-out date of 45V or repeals it, this question will resolve as **No sunset reduction before 2026**.
question_resolution_criteria.6:
This question will resolve as the outcome that is enacted next, before January 1, 2026, with respect to the planned start of the phase-out of the Clean Electricity Investment Tax Credit ([26 U.S. Code § 48E](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-investment-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-48e/)).

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**2025-2026 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 48E is fully repealed, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2025-2026 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 48E is fully repealed, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2027 or 2028, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2027 or 2028, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 48E is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

If no legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that reduces the planned phase-out date of 48E or repeals it, this question will resolve as **No sunset reduction before 2026**.
question_resolution_criteria.7:
This question will resolve as the total decrease in Medicaid spending over the period from fiscal year 2025 to 2034, inclusive, enacted as part of a spending reconciliation bill passed during fiscal year 2025. If no such reconciliation bill is enacted before the end of fiscal year 2025 (before October 1, 2025), this question will be **annulled**.

The question will resolve according to the cost estimate produced by the [Congressional Budget Office](https://www.cbo.gov/) (CBO) for the enacted reconciliation bill.
question_resolution_criteria.8: The question will be answered as **Yes** if, according to the sales price data published on the [ <u>Idealista portal</u> ](https://www.idealista.com/sala-de-prensa/informes-precio-vivienda/venta/madrid-comunidad/madrid-provincia/madrid/), the average price of housing in the **city of Madrid** per square meter rises by more than 18% from December 2024 to December 2025. It will be answered as **No** if the increase is 18% or less, or if there is a decrease in prices.
question_resolution_criteria.9: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, according to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) World Economic Outlook database, India's nominal GDP for 2025 exceeds that of Japan by the end of that year. It will be resolved as **No** if Japan's GDP remains higher or if both are equivalent.
question_resolution_criteria.10:
This question will resolve as the outcome that is enacted next, before January 1, 2026, with respect to the planned start of the phase-out of the Advanced Manufacturing Production Credit ([26 U.S. Code § 45X](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/advanced-manufacturing-production-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45x/)), when it pays out 100% of the credit value (explained further in the Fine Print).

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**2025-2026 sunset.** The planned phase-out date of 45X is moved to 2026 (meaning the final year of receiving 100% of the credit value is 2025) or 45X is fully repealed, effective either in 2026 or 2025.

**2027 sunset.** The planned phase-out date of 45X is moved to 2027 (meaning the final year of receiving 100% of the credit value is 2026).

**2028 sunset.** The planned phase-out date of 45X is moved to 2028 (meaning the final year of receiving 100% of the credit value is 2027).

**2029 sunset.** The planned phase-out date of 45X is moved to 2029 (meaning the final year of receiving 100% of the credit value is 2028).

If no legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that reduces the planned phase-out date of 45X, this question will resolve as **No sunset reduction before 2026**.
question_resolution_criteria.11:
This question will resolve as **Repealed fully** if a federal bill is enacted before January 1, 2026 which eliminates all adders to the Investment Tax Credit (48E) and the Production Tax Credit (45Y) established by the 2022 Inflation Reduction Act.

It will resolve as **Reduced incentives** If a federal bill is enacted before January 1, 2026 which either:

* removes at least one but not all adders to 48E or 45Y (e.g. specifically removes the adder for "prevailing wages"), or
* reduces the absolute amount or percentage of at least one adder to 48E or 45Y (e.g. reduces the "Siting in Energy Community" adder from 0.3c/kWh to 0.2c/kWh).

If no bill reducing or repealing the 48E or 45Y adders is enacted before January 1, 2026, this question will resolve as **Neither repealed nor reduced**.

For the purposes of this question, an adder is any provision that can conditionally increase either the Investment Tax Credit or Production Tax Credit available to US clean energy projects beyond the base credit, including any credits available conditional on worker wages or apprenticeships.
question_resolution_criteria.12: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, as of December 31, 2025 (or the previous trading date), Inditex is among the 10 largest companies by market capitalization in the European Union (EU). It will be resolved as **No** if it is below the 10th position or is not listed at all.
question_resolution_criteria.13: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Bank of England Prudential Regulation Authority (PRA) announces that Revolut has received a full UK banking license before July 26, 2025, GMT.
question_resolution_criteria.14: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if the price of Bitcoin at the end of December 31st, 2025 (or the last available day of record) is above $93,429.20, according to the Closing value on its [ <u>page on CoinMarketCap</u> ](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/bitcoin/historical-data/). It will be resolved as **No** if it is equal or lower.
question_resolution_criteria.15:
This question will resolve as the outcome that is enacted next, before January 1, 2026, with respect to the planned start of the phase-out of the Carbon Oxide Sequestration Tax Credit under [26 U.S. Code § 45Q](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/credit-for-carbon-oxide-sequestration-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45q/) for the beginning of construction of carbon sequestration facilities or equipment (see also [IRS Instructions for Form 8933](https://www.irs.gov/instructions/i8933)). 

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**2025-2026 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45Q is fully repealed, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2025-2026 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45Q is fully repealed, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2027 or 2028, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2027 or 2028, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Q is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

If no legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that reduces the planned phase-out date of 45Q or repeals it, this question will resolve as **No sunset reduction before 2026**.
question_resolution_criteria.16:
This question will resolve as the 2025 period in which the US Congress has successfully passed *any* bill via the special parliamentary procedure of reconciliation and said bill is signed by the President into law.

Should no such bill be passed and signed before January 1, 2026, this question will resolve as **Not in 2025**.
question_resolution_criteria.17: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if the [ <u>World Inequality Database</u> ](https://wid.world/) (WID) estimates that the "[ <u>Median national wealth at market value per adult</u> ](https://wid.world/world/#anweal_p0p100_z/WO/last/eu/k/p/yearly/a/false/48929.56/125000/curve/false/country)" for 2024 is higher than that in 2023. It will be resolved as **No** otherwise or if the value is equal to or lower.
question_resolution_criteria.18: The question will be answered as **Yes** if, as of December 31, 2025, the five largest global companies by market capitalization are in the technology sector, according to [ <u>CompaniesMarketCap</u> ](https://companiesmarketcap.com/). It will be answered as **No** if any of the top five are not considered technology companies.
question_resolution_criteria.19: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, according to [ <u>official Eurostat data</u> ](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/main/news/euro-indicators), Spain's real GDP growth (year-on-year percentage change from Q3 2024 to Q3 2025) exceeds aggregate Eurozone growth over the same period. It will be resolved as **No** if Eurozone growth is equal to or greater.
question_resolution_criteria.20: This question will be answered **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, OpenAI publishes a paper (e.g., a blog post, article, or video, but not a tweet) announcing the existence of GPT-5.
question_resolution_criteria.21:
This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, by January 1, 2026, at least one AI system is documented to achieve greater than 85% performance on the FrontierMath benchmark.

 The achievement must be reported in a document (such as a peer-reviewed paper, conference presentation, official benchmark publication, or a blog post by the AI developer). A simple reference to progress or internal assessments, without published performance results, will not qualify. If these results are not published, the question will be resolved as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.22:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the US Supreme Court holds in its 2025 decision pertaining to birthright citizenship that the Fourteenth Amendment does **not** require birthright citizenship for at least some children born in the United States who currently qualify.

The question will immediately resolve **No** if the Supreme Court issues an opinion that upholds the status quo of birthright citizenship.
question_resolution_criteria.23: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, by January 1st, 2026, Bluesky's user count reaches 100 million or more, according to [ <u>Jazco's Bluesky Stats</u> ](https://bsky.jazco.dev/stats) or another credible source. If the reported number is below 100 million, the question will be resolved as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.24: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, following the 2025 presidential election in Poland, Rafał Trzaskowski is officially declared president-elect. If this does not happen, this question will be resolved as **No**. This includes no elections being held before 1 January 2026 or the results of all 2025 elections being annulled.
question_resolution_criteria.25:
This question resolves as **Yes** if legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that (according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions)) eliminates transferability of one or more of the following tax credits: 

* [Clean Electricity Investment Tax Credit – 26 U.S. Code § 48E](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-investment-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-48e/)
* [Clean Electricity Production Tax Credit – 26 U.S. Code § 45Y](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-production-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45y/)
* [Advanced Manufacturing Production Credit – 26 U.S. Code § 45X](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/advanced-manufacturing-production-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45x/)
question_resolution_criteria.27:
This question will resolve as the outcome that is enacted next, before January 1, 2026, with respect to the planned start of the phase-out of the Clean Electricity Production Tax Credit ([26 U.S. Code § 45Y](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-production-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-45y/)).

The outcomes are defined as follows:

**2025-2026 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45Y is fully repealed, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2025-2026 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2025 or 2026 or 45Y is fully repealed, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2027 or 2028, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2027-2028 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2027 or 2028, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/o safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, with no safe harbor for ongoing projects.

**2029-2031 sunset w/ safe harbor**: The planned phase-out date of 45Y is moved to 2029, 2030, or 2031, but with a safe harbor for ongoing projects.

If no legislation is enacted before January 1, 2026 that reduces the planned phase-out date of 45Y or repeals it, this question will resolve as **No sunset reduction before 2026**.
question_resolution_criteria.28: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Nvidia's stock price at the close of the last business day of 2025 (on the primary exchange where it is listed, NASDAQ) exceeds $134.29, according to the Close/Last column on [ <u>its NASDAQ page</u> ](https://www.nasdaq.com/market-activity/stocks/nvda/historical). It will be resolved as **No** if it is equal or lower.
question_resolution_criteria.29: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if Spain is officially declared the winner of the Eurovision Song Contest 2025 by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) or through an official announcement documented in accredited media outlets. It will be resolved as **No** if Spain does not win the contest. In case no official winner is announced in 2025, the question will be resolved as **No**. In case of a tie, the question will be resolved as **Yes**.
question_resolution_criteria.30: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Microsoft's stock price at the close of the last business day of 2025 (on the primary exchange where it is listed, NASDAQ) exceeds $421.50, according to the Close/Last column on [ <u>its NASDAQ page</u> ](https://www.nasdaq.com/market-activity/stocks/msft/historical). It will be resolved as **No** if it is equal or lower.
question_resolution_criteria.32:
This question will resolve as the NATO defence spending target agreed upon at the 2025 NATO summit between July 24-26, 2025.

If the target agreed upon is not one of the values listed, this question will resolve as the highest value that is lower than the agreed upon target.

If there is a targeted range (such as 3-4%) the lower end of the range will be used.

If there is no new target, or the target is lowered, this question will resolve as **2 or lower**.
question_resolution_criteria.33: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, following the 2025 presidential election in Romania, Călin Georgescu is officially declared president-elect. If this does not happen, this question will be resolved as **No**. This includes if no election is held before 1 January 2026 or if the results of all 2025 elections are annulled, the question will be resolved as **No**.
question_resolution_criteria.34: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, a federal bill is enacted that makes the [existing requirements](https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/n-23-38.pdf) for the domestic content bonus credit mandatory for the Investment Tax Credits (ITC) described [26 U.S. Code § 48E](https://energycommunities.gov/funding-opportunity/clean-electricity-investment-tax-credit-26-u-s-code-%C2%A4-48e/).
question_resolution_criteria.35: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if, before January 1, 2026, Anthropic publishes a document (such as a blog post, article, or video) announcing the release of a model that is explicitly presented by Anthropic as the next major version/successor to the Claude 3/3.7 model family and that is given a new major version designation in Anthropic's model naming scheme.
question_resolution_criteria.36:
